meanings.definition: The act of applying something excessively or beyond what is necessary.
meanings.sent1: Her overapplication of makeup made her face look unnatural.
meanings.sent2: The overapplication of fertilizer caused the plants to wither.
meanings.sent3: His overapplication of enthusiasm for the project was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The overapplication of rules stifled creativity in the workplace.
meanings.sent5: The overapplication of force caused the fragile object to break.

meanings.definition: Excessive use or application of something.
meanings.sent1: The overapplication of salt made the dish inedible.
meanings.sent2: The overapplication of paint resulted in a thick, uneven coat.
meanings.sent3: The overapplication of perfume made everyone in the room sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The overapplication of technology led to a loss of human interaction.
meanings.sent5: The overapplication of pressure caused the machine to malfunction.
